content.user_title: Handle Agent Failures with Smart Retry Strategies
content.value_statement: Subagents often fail due to timeouts, unclear requirements, or scope issues. This skill provides proven retry patterns to recover from failures automatically.
actual_capabilities: Provides 5 distinct retry strategies for different failure types
Includes decision tree for choosing appropriate recovery method
Documents escalation paths for boundary/contract violations
Offers state tracking patterns for retry attempts
Contains integration examples for executor loops
limitations: Documentation only - no automated error recovery implementation
Requires manual integration into agent orchestration systems
Strategies assume access to task state and error information

use_cases.title: Build Resilient Multi-Agent Systems
use_cases.description: Implement robust error handling in agent orchestration platforms to handle transient failures and complex error scenarios.

use_cases.title: Handle Failed Subagent Tasks
use_cases.description: Apply retry strategies when Claude Code subagents fail due to timeouts, unclear requirements, or scope issues.

use_cases.title: Design Fault-Tolerant Workflows
use_cases.description: Create workflows that can recover from agent failures without manual intervention using proven retry patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Retry Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: My subagent failed with a timeout. Apply Strategy 1 (Simple Retry) with max 3 attempts. Track attempts in state file.

prompt_templates.title: Context Enhancement
prompt_templates.prompt: The implementer said 'I don't have enough context about the database schema'. Use Strategy 2 to add relevant schema files and examples.

prompt_templates.title: Scope Reduction
prompt_templates.scenario: Task too complex for single agent
prompt_templates.prompt: The agent completed partial authentication work then failed. Apply Strategy 3 to split 'Implement full auth system' into smaller subtasks.

prompt_templates.title: Contract Escalation
prompt_templates.prompt: Task is blocked with status 'boundary_violation'. Escalate to contract-resolver agent with current contracts and blocked reason.

output_examples.input: My subagent keeps failing to implement the API endpoint. It says the requirements are unclear.
output: Add these files to provide context: src/types/api.ts, examples/auth-endpoint.ts
Include clarification: 'Use JWT tokens, bcrypt for passwords, 15min expiry'
Retry with enhanced prompt containing original task + new context

output_examples.input: The implementer agent timed out while processing a large file. What should I do?
output: If all attempts fail, escalate with timeout details

output_examples.input: My task is blocked with a boundary violation error. How do I recover?
output: Gather blocked reason and current contracts
Wait for boundary expansion before retrying

best_practices: Always categorize the failure type before choosing a retry strategy
Track all retry attempts in state files for reflection and debugging
Preserve partial work from failed attempts when possible
anti_patterns: Don't retry blindly without analyzing the failure cause first
Avoid infinite retry loops - abort after 3 failed strategies
Don't discard partial work when agents complete some requirements

faq.question: Which retry strategy should I try first?
faq.answer: Start with Strategy 2 (Context Enhancement) for unclear failures. Use Strategy 1 for transient issues like timeouts.

faq.question: How many retry attempts are too many?
faq.answer: Abort after 3 failed strategies or 3 attempts of the same strategy. This prevents infinite loops.

faq.question: Can I use these patterns with any AI platform?
faq.answer: Yes, the patterns are platform-agnostic. They work with Claude, Codex, Claude Code, and other agent systems.

faq.question: What data should I track during retries?
faq.answer: Track attempt count, error messages, strategies tried, partial outputs, and any context added.

faq.question: How do I handle agents that keep asking questions?
faq.answer: This indicates missing context. Use Strategy 2 to proactively provide the information they're asking for.

faq.question: When should I escalate vs retry myself?
faq.answer: Escalate boundary/contract issues immediately. Retry implementation failures yourself first.
